comments:
On a fresh workspace with TPTP 4410_0828 candidate build on Linux, the 2nd launch throws error:

Agent Controller is unavailable under port 10006.... (please see screen capture)


org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.NotConnectedException
Unable to get a reference to the agent. The Client is not connected to the Agent Controller.

org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.exceptions.NotConnectedException: Unable to get a reference to the agent. The Client is not connected to the Agent Controller.

An unexpected error occured while attempting to establish a connection with the JVMTI agent.

Eugene did you use the external AC?

A similar error has been noted recently by Tatiana on the tptp-pmc mailing list.

IAC seems to work in some cases (with TPTP 4.4.0.2).

Hi Marius,

yes, IAC launched but it happened to have other problems as well.(bug 201443, and bug 201447).
But RAC should also work, this is a use case TPTP should support.
This seems to be an Agent Controller transport layer issue. Assigning to Joanna
Samson, please investigate for 441.  Please also respond to the related mailing list thread.  Thanks.
Hi Samson,
I think this is a kind of race condition problem.
Yesterday I fixed similar error by substitution of jvmti.client plugin from Aug 28 by the same from Aug 10.
The exception trace looks similar to bug 201443. The behaviour is the same for Windows->Windows, Windows->Linux and Linux->Linux except that when Windows workbench is used there will be no exception dialog.

Dup this to 201443 for further investigation.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 201443 ***

traces.message: Unable to get a reference to the agent. The Client is not connected to the Agent Controller.
